image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Anika Wells

props.synopsis: Pressed on whether his government should review the rules that allow politicians to fly their families around the country in business class, the prime minister says his focus is on the social media ban.

title.children: PM accused of shirking responsibility on Wells controversy

image.altText: The side profile of Greg Lynn leaving a court room wearing a suit.

props.synopsis: Former Jetstar pilot Greg Lynn has had his conviction for the murder of retiree Carol Clay overturned by Victoria's Court of Appeal.

title.children: Greg Lynn's murder conviction for death of High Country camper quashed

image.altText: Tourists in front of the Lincoln Memorial

props.synopsis: Australians travelling to the United States could soon face an unprecedented invasion of privacy, an international law expert has warned.

title.children: 'Politically active' travellers most at risk over US proposal to reveal social media history

image.altText: Fire burns from the top of a gas well at night.

props.synopsis: A long-awaited scheme to force east coast energy giants to set aside gas for Australian use is being finalised in down-to-the-wire negotiations between half a dozen cabinet ministers grappling with concerns it may not lower prices as much as hoped.

title.children: Australia's gas shortage blamed on 'stupid decisions' under Howard

image.altText: HESTA logo on a wall

props.synopsis: APRA says the fallout of HESTA's planned outage led to a "severe, prolonged disruption" that caused direct harm to some of its 1.1 million members, in a damning assessment of the fund.

title.children: 'A lesson for all funds': Super giant HESTA slammed by regulator

image.altText: A black and red oil tanker seen in a blue ocean, on a semi-blurred video screenshot with a green 'Unclassified' tag

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump says the tanker is "the largest one ever seized".

title.children: US seizes oil tanker off coast of Venezuela, Trump says

image.altText: GFX of Reserve Bank of Australia exterior laid over generic ASX images

props.synopsis: Market pricing for a February rate hike is on the up after the unemployment rate remained steady at 4.3 per cent, while fewer people have been in work or looking for a job. Meanwhile, APRA is taking action against super giant HESTA. Follow live.

title.children: Bets rise on RBA February interest rate hike after mixed jobs data

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: HESTA 'should be a lesson for all funds'
More concern about a February RBA rate hike

image.altText: A man in a suit and tie standing in front of a garden

props.synopsis: The prime minister wrote to states and territories this week, upping the Commonwealth's offer for public hospital funding.

title.children: 'Christmas Grinch': States lash PM’s latest public hospital offer

image.altText: Pedestrians

props.synopsis: Australia's unemployment rate holds steady at 4.3 per cent in November, but the underemployment rate jumps to 12-month high.

title.children: Australia's unemployment rate remains at 4.3 per cent, but underemployment surges

image.altText: A group of zombies surround a car.

props.synopsis: As more businesses look to do their own advertising, audience complaints for social media ads are growing.

title.children: Kia and Dettol ads top complaints list for 2025

image.altText: Rita, left, holds onto James, right, while both smile standing in their kitchen.

props.synopsis: Bespoke architectural builds on small budgets may seem like an impossible housing dream, but James and Rita managed to turn their vision into a reality — without breaking the bank.

title.children: In the depths of a housing crisis, James and Rita built their home for $320k

image.altText: A young man wearing a blue shirt and sunglasses outside the local court.

props.synopsis: The NT Court of Criminal Appeal has heard an appeal against the sentence for a 24-year-old driver who avoided a jail sentence after hitting two Aboriginal pedestrians with his vehicle, killing one, and then boasting about it over text.

title.children: 'Vile' and 'repugnant' texts sent by fatal hit-run driver at centre of appeal

image.altText: a red icebreaker in distance beside ice

props.synopsis: The federal government has announced more than $200 million in additional funding over the next seven years for Antarctic science and logistics.

title.children: Antarctic funding boost for more research voyages and science jobs

image.altText: Toyah Cordingley smiling with blonde hair and wearing a striped shirt, date unknown.

props.synopsis: The 24-year-old is remembered for her generous spirit and love of animals. It took a protracted effort to bring her killer back to Australia and before a court, during which time he revealed little emotion.

title.children: Inside the seven-year wait for justice for Toyah Cordingley

image.altText: Pete Hegseth, Richard Marles and John Healey stand at podiums in front of flags.

props.synopsis: The defence minister insists the AUKUS program is on track to provide Australia with nuclear-powered submarines in the next decade — despite the delays plaguing shipbuilding programs in both the US and the UK.

title.children: Hegseth praises Australia for 'stepping up' as Marles insists AUKUS is on track

image.altText: Dylan Brown runs the ball during a match for New Zealand

props.synopsis: New Zealand's Dylan Brown seemed a certainty to claim the Golden Boot as rugby league's best international player for 2025 but the Kiwi five-eighth has missed out in a stunning twist.

title.children: Dylan Brown denied rugby league Golden Boot in shock upset

image.altText: A film still of Adam Kiani, 25, a Pakistani British man with a moustache, smiling outside a community hall, holding a trophy.

props.synopsis: Every year, the Scottish town of Carrbridge hosts a porridge competition. Its contestants and chieftain are larger than life and celebrated in the new Aussie documentary The Golden Spurtle.

title.children: MasterChef for porridge: Inside the world of The Golden Spurtle

image.altText: The two performers who represented Iceland standing in silver suits holding the Icelandic flag.

props.synopsis: Iceland has joined Ireland, the Netherlands, Spain and Slovenia in boycotting the competition in protest against Israel's participation in the song contest.

title.children: Iceland becomes fifth country to boycott Eurovision 2026 over Israeli participation

image.altText: A watch, ring, bracelet, police tape.

props.synopsis: Police allege the men travelled to Australia to rob a Canberra home, stealing distinctive, luxury items.

title.children: Four French men came to Canberra for a $10m heist, police say

image.altText: Kellie Sloane wearing a white suit stands behind a lectern with four people stood behind her.

props.synopsis: NSW Opposition Leader Kellie Sloane says changes to the state's workers' compensation scheme are an important "reset".

title.children: 'Reset' for workers' comp scheme in NSW as sweeping changes agreed

image.altText: Michael Jeffries with his head down getting into a car.

props.synopsis: Former Abercrombie & Fitch boss Michael Jeffries, who is part of a trio accused of luring men to drug-fuelled parties with the promise of modelling jobs, is facing federal sex trafficking charges.

title.children: Abercrombie & Fitch ex-CEO fit for sex trafficking trial, prison officials say

image.altText: Photo shows a logo for Netflix on a remote control

props.synopsis: Australians' electricity bills have become a nightmare of complexity and high prices. An energy regulator says subscription fees could be an answer.

title.children: Australia's energy rule-maker calls for 'Netflix-like' power charges

image.altText: Illustration of hands using flint and pyrite to produce sparks.

props.synopsis: Archaeologists have uncovered the earliest-known evidence of deliberately lit campfires at a site in the UK dated to be 400,000 years old.

title.children: Ancient campfire pushes back date early humans first made fires

image.altText: A teen girl sits at a vanity looking at her phone.

props.synopsis: After a year of waiting, Australia's world-leading laws to block kids from accessing social media are officially enacted. But the teens they're meant to impact say not much has actually changed.

title.children: Australia's social media experiment is live. Teens say nothing has changed

image.altText: A middle aged man stands in front of a fence with his arms around his wife

props.synopsis: Calls for politicians' family travel entitlements to be tightened are growing, as analysis shows one Nationals MP was allowed to charge taxpayers more than $80,000 to fly his spouse to and from Canberra 27 times in two years.

title.children: Nationals MP's high family travel bill highlights generous rules

image.altText: Walter Sofronoff dressed in court robes walks down a street. in Brisbane

props.synopsis: The man who led the inquiry into the criminal prosecution of Bruce Lehrmann loses his appeal to have serious corruption findings against him overturned.

title.children: Walter Sofronoff loses appeal against corruption finding

image.altText: Chris Murphy and Katie Britt speak to each other while seated together.

props.synopsis: As Australians under 16 lose their social media accounts, influential Republicans and Democrats are pushing the US Congress to consider a similar ban for children under 13.

title.children: Australia prompts US to consider kids' social media ban

image.altText: A close shot of Brereton, who is sitting in the offices of the new national anti--corruption commission

props.synopsis: National Anti-Corruption Commission chief Paul Brereton formally discloses his consulting work for the defence watchdog after the ABC reveals the links.

title.children: NACC chief updates official declaration of interests to disclose defence link

image.altText: Sherrone Moore coaching Michigan's football team

props.synopsis: Sherrone Moore's rollercoaster tenure with Michigan comes to an end midway through its second season as the college shows zero tolerance for his actions.

title.children: 'Inappropriate relationship' with staffer sees $5.5m-a-year coach sacked

image.altText: A man in a green prison uniform sits looking into a webcam in a plain office room with white walls. He has a neutral expression.

props.synopsis: A landmark legal case against three of Australia's biggest online betting agencies has been filed in the Federal Court, aimed at recovering millions of dollars' worth of stolen money that was gambled away and kept by corporate bookmakers.

title.children: Landmark legal case could force betting agencies to return stolen millions

image.altText: Man with almost bald hair, white shirt, green leaves and trees in background

props.synopsis: Blackwater massage therapist Donovan Webb has been charged with a further 40 counts of sexual assault alleged to have taken place during massage therapy sessions.

title.children: Massage therapist charged with additional sexual assault offences

image.altText: A police car on a residential road.

props.synopsis: Tehata Hapuku has been named as the sixth person charged over the fatal stabbing of Nowra man Gordon Kessey near a park in Bega on the NSW far south coast.

title.children: Sixth person charged with murder after man stabbed near Bega park

image.altText: A wide brown river and farms

props.synopsis: Jindalee Road Wines and its former manager have been penalised $558,000 for illegally tapping into an irrigation pipeline and stealing water.

title.children: Water thieves forced to pay $558,000

image.altText: The back of a man's head, looking at a laptop screen with a Facebook ad from GIM Trading on it.

props.synopsis: Tech giant Meta ran advertisements used to lure Australian investors into a fraudulent bond scheme that allegedly defrauded tens of millions of dollars from them.

title.children: 'I know it's been stolen': Businessman loses $300k in alleged bond scam

image.altText: Customers enjoy their pasta at a restaurant in Rome sat opposite eachother at a table

props.synopsis: Already loved around the world for its palate-pleasing tastes, UNESCO has now added the rituals surrounding Italian food preparation and consumption to its list of the world's traditional practices and expressions.

title.children: Italian cooking is now a part of the world's 'intangible' cultural heritage
